cheatsheet.title: Create a new functional dependency analysis

intro.description:
This analysis helps you to detect anomalies in your column dependencies. It specifies to what extent the values of a column A determine the values of a column B. This relationship is denoted as A->B.
The value of a “City” column, for instance, determines the value of a “Country” column, except in certain rare cases.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata.
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click Analyses on the DQ Repository view and select New Analysis. Then expand Table Analysis and select Functional Dependency Analysis. The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify the analysis metadata and define the analysis settings.

item.title: Select the left columns to analyze.
item.description: In the editor, click Analysed Columns Set to open the corresponding view. Click A Column Set(or click the link below). The column selection dialog box opens in which you can browse to and select the columns of interest. Alternatively, drop the columns from the DQ Repository tree view onto the box.

item.title: Select the right columns to analyze.
item.description: In the editor, click Analysed Columns Set to open the corresponding view. Click B Column Set(or click the link below). The column selection dialog box opens in which you can browse to and select the columns of interest. Alternatively, drop the columns from the DQ Repository tree view onto the box.

item.title: Analyze.
item.description: Click the Run icon, located towards the top left of the editor, to execute the analysis. Alternatively, right click the analysis on the DQ Repository tree view and click the Run icon on the list which appears.
